main event: A torpedo-shaped object was spotted in the sky over Durban, South Africa on February 26, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as bright dark red in color, traveling through a whirling wind, and shifting from a horizontal to a vertical position towards the ground.
The object was also seen by passengers waiting for a train at Merewbank station, who described it as a blue, torpedo-shaped object that was silent and stationary in the sky.
The object was reported to travel only from south to north.
The object was observed for around 1-2 minutes and was the size of a small jet aircraft.
The object changed colors from silver to gold as the sun's rays struck it.
witnesses: a civilian, passengers on a train platform
